result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon R. Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges; Drug Surcharge.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 40 days in the county jail, commencing 7/9/16 @ 8am.  Credit for 8 days served.  Huber privileges are allowed including child care.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations or disruptive groups.  May not have contact with any individuals who use or traffic in controlled substances.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Pay prosecution costs totaling $43.00.

timeConds.notes: Huber and work crew privileges are allowed including child care.  Credit for 8 days served.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Brandon R. Martin, appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 40 days in the KCJ commencing on 7/9/16 at 8:00 AM.  Credit for 8 days.  Huber & Work Crew authorized including Child Care.   Parties stipulate to prosecution costs in the amount of $43.00.  Costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Copy of Letter from Robyn Woods to Atty Bates

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Brandon R. Martin, appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates.   Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 1:30 PM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Brandon R. Martin, appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved at this time.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
